result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley T Sleeter Jr

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Bradley T Sleeter Jr appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Matter set for adjourned INIT.  DE has not applied for PD representation yet.  DE was instructed to call PD office in the AM when they open is best to see if he is eligible for PD.   Matter adjourned to 1/11/23 at 1:45 PM.   Adj. 1:33 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 11, 2023 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances unless prescribed to defendant and then to be taken only as prescribed.

1:20 PM Defendant Bradley T Sleeter Jr in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. DE will need to apply for PD services. 

State requests a  $2500.00 sign bond, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances unless prescribed to defendant and then to be taken only as prescribed. So ordered by the court.
